definitions.definition: the language, originally of England, now spoken in many other countries and used as a language of international communication throughout the world

examples.text: I need to improve my English.
They taught conversational English to a group of Japanese students.

definitions.definition: English language or literature as a subject of study
the people of England (sometimes wrongly used to mean the British, including the Scots, the Welsh and the Northern Irish)
simply and clearly expressed, without using technical language

examples.text: a document written in plain English
If you could put it in plain English I might be able to understand.
Teachers should encourage students to write in plain English.

wordOrigin: Old English Englisc (from Angle, a Germanic people who came to England in 5th century AD + -ish). The word originally denoted the early Germanic settlers of Britain (Angles, Saxons, and Jutes), or their language (now called Old English).
